speaker: FIRST MISSIONARY
line: Good afternoon. I hope we're not bothering you.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Actually, I'm just...

speaker: SECOND MISSIONARY
line: We really won't take up much of your time.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: I'm just waiting for a call...

speaker: FIRST MISSIONARY
line: We're all waiting, ma'am... for the good Lord to call in his flock.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: ... from the cable TV people. I'm just moving in. God bless.

speaker: FIRST MISSIONARY
line: Good afternoon. I hope... we're not bothering...

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Yes?

speaker: SECOND MISSIONARY
line: You're... Weren't you...

speaker: FIRST MISSIONARY
line: Yeah, didn't we just...

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Didn't you just what?

speaker: SECOND MISSSIONARY
line: Speak to you.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Excuse me?

speaker: FIRST MISSIONARY
line: We just spoke to a woman who...

speaker: SECOND MISSIONARY
line: ... could have been your twin.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: FIRST MISSIONARY
line: Yeah, just down the street-- she's just moving in-- your spitting image.

speaker: SECOND MISSIONARY
line: You're really not going to believe it when you see her.

speaker: FIRST MISSIONARY
line: Ma'am?

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Go away! Get out of here!

speaker: COP
line: Cuff him!

speaker: MULDER'S VOICE
line: Betty Templeton?

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Yes?

speaker: MULDER'S VOICE
line: We're with the FBI. We'd like to ask about an incident-- a possible religious hate crime in your neighborhood.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: I just moved in yesterday. I don't know anything about any incident.

speaker: SCULLY'S VOICE
line: Well, we have two young men in the car who say you do know something.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Oh, my God. Those are the boys that were here yesterday. What happened?

speaker: MULDER'S VOICE
line: They were beaten to within an inch of their lives by each other after visiting the home of a woman living a few blocks over.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: What woman?

speaker: SCULLY'S VOICE
line: A woman who, by both young men's accounts fits your description.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: She, uh... lives around here?

speaker: MULDER'S VOICE
line: Are you a practitioner of the occult, Miss Templeton? Wicca? Voodoo? Satanism? The black art of bodily bilocation?

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Me? No. You know what they say-- everyone has a twin out there somewhere.

speaker: MAN WHO LOOKS LIKE MULDER
line: No, we don't know what they say.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Well, if there's someone who fits my description, why isn't someone talking to her?

speaker: WOMAN WHO LOOKS LIKE SCULLY
line: We went over to the house, but it's empty. No one lives there.

speaker: MAN WHO LOOKS LIKE MULDER
line: Frankly, we're not even sure she exists.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is an FBI fleet sedan from our Kansas City field office requisitioned by two seasoned agents there driven into a tree at 43 miles an hour by the female agent in a novel effort to kill her male counterpart. Now, you might think I'm going to suggest psychokinesis-- pk-- someone or something controlling the agents with remote, mind-bending power.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But it's not?

speaker: MULDER
line: Both agents sustained critical injuries. Their stories eerily similar...

speaker: MULDER
line: ... as if they temporarily lost control of their minds unable to alter their behavior.

speaker: MULDER
line: You may think that I'm going to say it's past lives unresolved or fate, stalking the agents like an animal...

speaker: SCULLY
line: ... but you're not.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, the interesting thing about these agents is they had worked together for seven years previously without any incident.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Seven years?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but they are not... romantically involved if that's what you're thinking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not even I would be so farfetched.

speaker: MULDER
line: You have any ideas, Scully, any thoughts?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What I'm thinking, Mulder, is how familiar this seems. Playing Watson to your Sherlock. You dangling clues out in front of me one by one. It's a game, and... and, as usual, you're, you're holding something back from me. You're not telling me something about this case.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hmm...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, so these agents were investigating something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Something... much like what they themselves were almost killed by. Uh, something they came into contact with. Uh... Third party?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Two third parties. Twins? Relatives? A doppelganger?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A corporeal likeness that appears unbidden from the spirit world the sight of which presages one's own death or... a double, conjured into the world by a technique called bilocation...

speaker: SCULLY
line: ... which in psychological terms represents the person's secret desires and impulses committing acts that the, uh, real person cannot commit himself... or herself?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, the slide, please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes!

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't go thinking I'm going to start doing the autopsies.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Excuse me. Hi, I applied for the sales job you posted.

speaker: FIRST KOKO'S MANAGER
line: Ah, yeah, I remember. How could I forget?

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Excuse me?

speaker: FIRST KOKO'S MANAGER
line: Uh, there's a problem with your application as I recall, Miss...

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Pfeiffer. Are you sure?

speaker: FIRST KOKO'S MANAGER
line: Lulu Pfeiffer. Yes, you reside at 15527 Moreton Bay Street?

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Not any longer, I've moved.

speaker: FIRST KOKO'S MANAGER
line: You moved?

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Yes, and I don't have my new address yet.

speaker: FIRST KOKO'S MANAGER
line: Actually, Miss Pfeiffer, that's what's sending up the red flag. You move a lot and there's also your employment history-- 17 jobs in 17 states in the past three years? You seem to have as many jobs here as you have addresses.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: I had a restless streak.

speaker: FIRST KOKO'S MANAGER
line: Well, the copy business takes a motivated person.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Oh, I'm an extremely versatile employee as you can see by my resume.

speaker: FIRST KOKO'S MANAGER
line: Well, what I can tell is you've left a variety of palm reader.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Yes, but I am on a career path now.

speaker: SECOND CUSTOMER
line: Hey, what's going on here? All my copies are black!

speaker: THIRD CUSTOMER
line: My machine's going crazy.

speaker: FEMALE CUSTOMER
line: Who's running this place?

speaker: FIRST KOKO'S MANAGER
line: I can start you immediately. There's a clean uniform in the employee washroom.

speaker: SECOND KOKO'S MANAGER
line: That's quite a string of positions you've had, Miss... Templeton. 17 jobs in the last three years.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: I would've listed more but there wasn't any room left on your form.

speaker: SECOND KOKO'S MANAGER
line: 17's plenty, believe me.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: I think you'll find my former employers will only give the highest personal references.

speaker: SECOND KOKO'S MANAGER
line: It's not your references, it's the jobs themselves. Mongolian barbecue chef, high-rise window washer, wild animal trainer?

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: I'm a highly versatile employee.

speaker: SECOND KOKO'S MANAGER
line: What guarantee do I have that you won't just up and quit tomorrow?

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: You have my personal word on it. I'm here in Kansas City to stay.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Who is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Zupanic, it's the FBI.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Excuse me?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's the FBI, Mr. Zupanic. Open up.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Give me a minute.

speaker: MULDER
line: Bert Zupanic?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Yeah?

speaker: MULDER
line: We're hoping you can help us find the whereabouts of a woman we think you're familiar with, a Betty Templeton.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: I don't know no Betty Templeton.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe you should take another look at that photograph, Mr. Zupanic. Five-foot three, red hair. Maybe I can jog your memory.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you still pleading ignorance, Mr. Zupanic? Is that not you in last year's Fourth of July parade?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And who's that sitting next to you?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Her?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Try Betty Templeton. We can't find her, Mr. Zupanic. She seems to have left town in a hurry.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: She did?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mm-hmm.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Didn't she used to live on Moreton Bay in a pink house?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Alderwood, blue house.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: On Alderwood?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Zupanic, do you have any reason to be lying to us?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: No, sir. I mean, ma'am.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you, Mr. Zupanic. I've no doubt we'll be in touch with you.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know what I'm thinking?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That Mr. Zupanic not only knows Betty Templeton and where we can find her but that he is hip to whatever she's into and that I should take a look at that house he mentioned on Moreton Bay Street while you go and find out from Mr. Zupanic what it is exactly that he's clearly hiding about Betty Templeton.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm thinking that Bert Zupanic really truly doesn't know Betty Templeton.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I guess that's why they put the "I" in the FBI.

speaker: JUKEBOX
line: "I'm going to be standing on the corner of 12th and Vine Going to be standing on the corner of 12th Street and Vine."

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Let me get a double, Freddie.

speaker: FREDDIE
line: I thought you're in training, Bert, my man.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Would you just pour?

speaker: JUKEBOX
line: "Well, I might take a train I might take a plane But if I have to walk I'm going just the same I'm going to Kansas City, Kansas City here I come."

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Nice outfit.

speaker: JUKEBOX
line: "They got some crazy little women there."

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Freddie, fire in the hole. Seven and seven for the lady and make it stiff.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Oh, my God. How did you do that?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Do what?

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: How did you know my drink?

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: I feel like you're looking right through me. Like you're reading my soul like a book.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Maybe you've had enough of that. You are in trouble, aren't you?

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: I don't know. I could be. What kind of trouble are you looking for?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: You don't want to go home tonight, okay?

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: It just so happens I don't got a home to go to. Anyway... I'm Betty Templeton.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Alderwood Avenue?

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: My God.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: I'm shaking.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: "Betty Templeton." Oh, that's perfect.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: I got to take care of...

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully!

speaker: MULDER
line: I want you to meet a buddy of mine. It's Mr. Argyle Sapersteen.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Stein.

speaker: MULDER
line: Saperstein, excuse me.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Ma'anish ta na.

speaker: [TD
line: Hebrew, I'm told it means "Yeah, so what else is new?".]

speaker: MULDER
line: This is my partner, Dana Scully.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Pleasure and an honor.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So I take it from your posture, Mulder, you've solved this case.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not solved it, but I have narrowed down the search for our perpetrator with the kind help of Mr. Saperstein here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Narrowed it down to where?

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Right down there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Our mystery woman is indeed involved with Mr. Bert Zupanic, the man we spoke to at his hotel, who will be fighting here two days hence with the mystery woman almost undoubtedly in attendance.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: If it's the lady I'm thinking, she's not much to look at, but he says she brings him luck.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Bert Zupanic is a boxer?

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: A wrestler-- semipro.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So what? We wait around Kansas City for a couple of days until we can talk with this woman?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, there's lots to do here, and the barbecue's second to none right, Mr. Saperstein? Plus Mr. Saperstein's going to show me some in-your-face, smack-down moves so I can quit getting my ass kicked so often, right? Oh, and there's an art exhibit that traces the influence of Soviet art on the American pop culture, right? Unless, of course you've already found Betty Templeton.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, finding Betty Templeton won't solve this case, Mulder. Not unless we find Lulu Pfeiffer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who's Lulu Pfeiffer?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Our doppelganger who lived, until yesterday in a pink house on Moreton Bay Street, but she's not a manifestation, Mulder, she's real and so is the path of destruction that she's left in her wake. Though there seems to be no connection of any kind between these two women, Betty Templeton and Lulu Pfeiffer have traveled city to city across 17 U.S. States, one alternately trailing the other for the past 12 years and wherever they have been, mayhem has followed. house and Lulu in the blue.]

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Damn.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not just car accidents and fistfights, Mulder. It's house fires and explosions and even riots.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: The lady knows her stuff.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sholom alecheim.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Yeah. Yo' mama.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Hello?

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Where's my money?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: I got it. I'm bringing it.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Yeah, that's what I heard last night. Now you got the feds on your ass.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: What?

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Good luck charm don't sound so lucky no more, Boychick. Maybe I should cancel the fight.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: I'm bringing the money, okay? I'm bringing it.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: I'm having lunch at Froggy's. No money, no fight, Titanic.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Are you in trouble or something?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: I'm just, uh... I got to be somewhere, okay?

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Why? What time is it? Oh, God, I'm going to be late for work!

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: You were incredible. Why do I find myself so wildly attracted to you, Bert Zupanic?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: You just can't help yourself, baby.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Where were you last night?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Where was I?

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Yeah.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Well...

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: You said, "meet me for a drink."

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: That's what you said.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: I was there and I was waiting on you.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Are you two-timing me, Bert?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: How can you say that? You're my good luck charm.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Who is she?!

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: "Who is she?"

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: You do not want to get in the ring with me, mister!

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Honey, listen. Come on, baby, there's nobody under there. You're acting crazy, sweetie!

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Hey, I know this hairpin.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Oh, I can explain that.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: You lovable lug, Bert Zupanic. I'm sorry, baby. This is mine.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Of course it is.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: I just get so jealous. You forgive me?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: I forgive you. I'm in training. You got to go to work. You're late.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: No. I'm just so wildly attracted to you, Bert Zupanic.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Hey, listen, good looks and charm-- what's not to love, all right?

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: There's a lot to love.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: I know. Go on.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: But you are...

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: No, you have to go.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Will you call me at least?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: You bet. I'm on the phone now, okay? Bye, baby.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Bert, did I hear voices?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Voices? I didn't hear any voices.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Oh.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Where's "The Titanic?"

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: What?

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Your boyfriend, the wrestler.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Wow, talk about moves. I can't believe it. We barely just met.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: He's supposed to meet me, here.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: He's coming here?

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: He'd better be, if he wants that fight Saturday night.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: I better go freshen up a little. I was just coming in for lunch.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Zupanic, hey. Thought you were a no-show.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Talking to your girlfriend.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: My girlfriend?

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Holy sugar.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Now, how did she do that?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Do what?

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: I just saw her. I swear, I just saw her go to the can.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: She... just went... to the can?

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Ten seconds ago.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: I have a business meeting. Why don't I meet you outside in the park?

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Uh, I was just going to get some lunch.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Perfect, we'll have a picnic.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: A picnic? We never do that.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Oh, yeah...

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Now.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Bert?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: I have a little business to attend to, sweetie.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: You got more than that to attend to.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Hey, Bert, I only got an hour...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Zupanic?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Hmm. What, uh... What happened?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, there was an incident. You were struck by flying glass.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you lose something?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Yeah. My good luck.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Would that be Betty or Lulu, Mr. Zupanic?

speaker: SCULLY
line: 'Cause they're the ones who caused this and they'll do it again if we can't find them. Where are they, Mr. Zupanic?

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me. FBI.

speaker: SECOND KOKO'S MANAGER
line: Can I help you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, I'm looking for...

speaker: MULDER
line: ... that girl.

speaker: SECOND KOKO'S MANAGER
line: Betty. This man's from the FBI.

speaker: MULDER
line: Betty Templeton?

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: I'm just getting off work. Could we maybe talk some other time?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think we both know why I'm here.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: It's her fault!

speaker: MULDER
line: Lulu Pfeiffer.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: She follows me around trying to ruin my life. I'm not going to let her ruin it this time. It's either me or her. I don't want to leave Kansas.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully. I found her at Koko's Copy Center.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Betty Templeton?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. She says that Lulu Pfeiffer's trying to ruin her life. She follows her wherever she goes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, Lulu Pfeiffer works at Koko's, too. And that's exactly what Lulu says about Betty, Mulder. Except she says that this is the end of the line, that she's not leaving Kansas.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's exactly what Betty said.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's going on here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, Scully. You're running this show. Why don't you tell me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I think that this is more than just physical proximity, Mulder. I think that these women have some kind of a psychic connection.

speaker: MULDER
line: No , Sherlock. Hey, Scully, uh... where's Lulu?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She just took off, Mulder. She left work and she drove away.

speaker: MULDER
line: She wouldn't be driving a little blue convertible, would she?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's exactly what she's driving.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, crap.

speaker: MANAGER
line: Can I help you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, yes. I'm looking for someone. He was here speaking to an employee and, uh, I can't seem to reach him.

speaker: MANAGER
line: Tall guy, dark hair?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MANAGER
line: He left.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you don't know where he went?

speaker: MANAGER
line: Couldn't say. However... I can tell you we have a two-for-one copy discount in effect.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How about Internet access?

speaker: MANAGER
line: Right this way.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is he in there?

speaker: PRISON GUARD
line: Yeah. Sleeping.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you wake him up for me?

speaker: PRISON GUARD
line: Sure you want to do that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's important.

speaker: ANGRY BOB DANFOUS
line: Will you two shut up or go away!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Danfous?

speaker: ANGRY BOB DANFOUS
line: The sound of your voice is like a jackhammer on my eardrums!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Danfous, I'm Special Agent Dana Scully with the FBI.

speaker: ANGRY BOB DANFOUS
line: What's so special about you?!

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's an FBI title, sir.

speaker: ANGRY BOB DANFOUS
line: I know it is. I'm not stupid!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Danfous, if you'll let me explain why I'm here we might be able to get you to bed a little bit sooner.

speaker: ANGRY BOB DANFOUS
line: Ah, what a relief!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Danfous, through a lot of matching-up of documents that I have been able to compile on the Internet, and by comparing time and space and circumstance and by liberally applying the law of averages...

speaker: ANGRY BOB DANFOUS
line: They could electrocute me quicker!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I believe that you may be the father of two daughters.

speaker: ANGRY BOB DANFOUS
line: I'm no father!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Using documents filed by a sperm bank in Sparta, Illinois and by the mothers who may have been impregnated by your donation...

speaker: ANGRY BOB DANFOUS
line: I Yankee Doodled into a plastic cup!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, be that as it may, sir, it is very likely that you are the biological father. And it is very important for their safety and for the safety of others that we get as much information as possible about your mother and your father and anything about your family tree that may be able to explain the reactions that are being caused by these two girls.

speaker: ANGRY BOB DANFOUS
line: A big, ugly dog lifted its leg on my family tree.

speaker: ANOTHER INMATE
line: Make room for daddy!

speaker: ANGRY BOB DANFOUS
line: Shut up, you fat ox!

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Hello.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: You aren't answering your phone?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: I'm just screening my calls.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: You sleep with me once and now you're avoiding me?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: I got... big trouble, baby. I got just one shot left at the big time. Just one.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: But you got your match tonight. Your name's up on the marquee!

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: I've lost my financing. You're my good luck, baby.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: I am?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: It was my good luck to meet you and if you could just... if you could help "The Titanic" find a way...

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Find a way?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: They say I'm old. I'm washed up. All I want's a shot. If I don't get the money I'm gonna lose my chance.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Maybe I can.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: You're not answering your phone?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Lulu?

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Someone else you were expecting? Well?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Baby, I got trouble. I got big trouble.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where have you been?

speaker: MULDER
line: Seeing a side of Kansas City few men have the privilege to see.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened to you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I got sucked into a storm drain. The more pressing question is what the hell happened to Betty Templeton and Lulu Pfeiffer?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know, but I have been able to locate the nature of their connection. Both women are non-fraternal siblings from the same father.

speaker: MULDER
line: You've located him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. He's here in the state pen.

speaker: ANGRY BOB DANFOUS
line: When is all this yammering gonna stop?

speaker: MULDER
line: And he's given you insight?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, the biggest thing that I can figure out right now is he's probably the angriest man in the world, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not as angry as those two women are going to be when they both realize they're in love with the one and only Bert Zupanic.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They're both after him?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, they're both in love with him. That's why they're both staying in Kansas City and they won't leave.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if they're the reason it doesn't explain what's happening, what's causing this phenomenon or how we're going to make it stop.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look, Scully, I don't know. You're the one who's supposed to have all the answers. Somebody's got to get to that fight and keep those two women apart or else this time the is going to hit the fans.

speaker: INMATE
line: Well, hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Zupanic?

speaker: CROWD
line: Come on, Jimmy! Yay! Yeah!

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: You said you'd have my money.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: I'll have it. I-I swear I will.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: I'll call off the damn fight, Titanic. I'll have these people cursing your damn name.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: I'm telling you it'll be here, don't worry. I promise.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Bert! Bert. I got it.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: How 'bout your buddy?

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Let's get ready to rumble.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Oh, baby. I knew you wouldn't let me down.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: It's you and me. All the way.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Ladies and gentlemen, get out your seats and on your feets for our own hometown boy gone bad... Bert "The Titanic" Zuuu... panic!

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Titanic!

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Oh, yeah!

speaker: CROWD
line: Let's take 'em, baby! Let's take 'em, baby! Whoo! Whoo! Come on!

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Whoo! Go, Titanic!

speaker: MULDER
line: Betty Templeton. My name is Fox Mulder. I'm with the FBI. Can you come with me?

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: I'm watching the fight.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't make me have to remove you, ma'am.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: I can't believe this. What are you doing here?

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: What are you doing here? I'm Bert's good luck.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: He's mine.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Over my dead body.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Stop it! Stop it! You're going down, lady! I'm going to kick your butt from here to Tuesday! Stick a fork in you, you're done!

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Hi, baby.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Betty.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Bert, keep it up! I love you, baby!

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Bert. I got the money.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Lulu?

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Kick his butt, Bert.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Lulu.

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Bert!

speaker: BETTY TEMPLETON
line: Oh, my.

speaker: LULU PFEIFFER
line: Oh, my God.

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: What?

speaker: BERT ZUPANIC
line: Why...

speaker: SCULLY
line: 50 million anonymous donations have been made to sperm banks across the U.S. Most have produced healthy offspring for single mothers or fertility-challenged couples while some of them have not.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Bert Zupanic and his non-fraternal biological sibling both small-time bank robbers, part-time pro wrestlers, both with too many idiosyncratic behaviorisms to list stood a 27-million-to-one chance of ever meeting but they did.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Damn, those are some odds.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Betty Templeton and Lulu Pfeiffer products of different mothers but the same father-

speaker: SCULLY
line: ... an angry drifter now doing time for counterfeiting-- chanced to meet 12 years ago, but couldn't seem to avoid each other's compulsively identical mannerisms, mannerisms attributable to their perpetually angry father.

speaker: SAPERSTEIN
line: Mm. What does it all mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've been thinking hard about that, Mr. Saperstein. I would like to say it has something to do with balance in the universe, the attraction of opposites and the repulsion of equivalents, or that over time, nature produces only so many originals that when two original copies meet that the result is often unpredictable.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If four should meet, the result is... well, suffice to say it's better just to avoid these encounters altogether and at all costs. I think Agent Mulder would agree with me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mm-hmm. Mmmm.
